description: TCU Core Curriculum - all BS students including Kinesiology majors must complete 39-63 hours of Core Curriculum. Some courses may satisfy multiple requirements, reducing total hours needed.

buckets.name: Fine Arts
buckets.outcome: Explore the creative and expressive processes of the human experience in the arts.

buckets.name: Humanities
buckets.outcome: Use humanistic modes of inquiry to analyze human experiences and expressions across space and time.

buckets.name: Social Sciences
buckets.outcome: Apply social science methodologies to analyze fundamental social processes that characterize human experiences.

buckets.name: Historical Traditions
buckets.outcome: Examine the processes that create change over time in the human experience.

buckets.name: Literary Traditions
buckets.outcome: Examine literature's connections to society and culture.

buckets.name: Religious Traditions
buckets.outcome: Examine the role of religion in society, culture and individual life.

buckets.name: Mathematics
buckets.outcome: Apply mathematical reasoning to solve problems.

buckets.name: Natural Sciences
buckets.outcome: Use scientific reasoning to evaluate ideas in the natural world.
commonCourses: PHYS 10154 General Physics I with Lab

buckets.name: Oral Communication
buckets.outcome: Express messages in various situations using appropriate verbal and nonverbal communication skills.

buckets.name: Written Communication 1
buckets.outcome: Express ideas in various situations using writing processes and strategies.

buckets.name: Written Communication 2
buckets.outcome: Analyze and compose evidence-based arguments in various forms.

buckets.name: Writing Emphasis
buckets.outcome: Write for a specific discipline, profession, or field using a writing process that emphasizes revision.

buckets.name: Cultural Awareness
buckets.outcome: Explore culture and cultural phenomena as sites of identity, difference, understanding, or collaboration.

buckets.name: Global Awareness
buckets.outcome: Analyze the dynamics, processes, or legacies of global systems.

buckets.name: Citizenship and Social Values
buckets.outcome: Examine the knowledge, skills, values, or motivation needed to participate or lead within diverse communities.

notes: No more than four requirements (not including OCO and WCO) may be met in one subject area as indicated by prefix.
Courses fulfilling core curriculum requirements may also count toward other degree requirements.
Kinesiology majors: MATH 10043 satisfies Math requirement; BIOL 20204 and BIOL 20214 satisfy Natural Sciences for most majors.
Harris College students must take Cultural Awareness, Global Awareness, and Citizenship/Social Values courses at TCU — these cannot transfer in.
